channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023080766
item.description:
Report E-2023080766

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN1993 PenRay Winter Pow-R Plus Diesel Anti-Gel release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 7-gallons of product released to a 15’ x 8’ area of the dock floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area and then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080323
item.description:
Report E-2023080323

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a NA1993 Spec-Aid 8Q123ULS release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of product released impacting a 5" x 1" area of the tote lid due to being crushed/punctured as a result of improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with cleanup debris into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE CONTAINER WAS LEAKING AS SOON AS IT WAS NOTICED IT WAS PLACED INTO THE PROPER RED RECEPTICAL DescribePack: THE BOX WAS FIBERBOARD, INTERNAL LEAKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The up arrows may have not been followed and package was turned on it's side allowing product to escape from valve on top of drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080336
item.description:
Report E-2023080336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 28, 2023, one (1) 7.5-gallon pail of resin was crushed by surrounding freight and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HazChem personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged drum were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of surfactant (un1760) had a defective seam and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080256
item.description:
Report E-2023080256

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 25, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and damaged drum were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and one (1) 85-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal.

  • Description: Employee was loading the package when he heard it pop. He placed the package on the floor and it began to smoke. There were no markings or labels indicating the box contained a lithium ion battery without equipment. No injuries.

item.title: Report E-2023080205
item.description:
Report E-2023080205

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 20, 2023, six (6) 5-gallon pails of UN1866 were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the shrink wrap and pallet. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. The cardboard, shrink wrap, and damaged containers were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. Crews.

item.title: Report E-2023080173
item.description:
Report E-2023080173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3295 was damaged and released approximately one half (.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE contained the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum. HCE deployed absorbents and utilized hand tools to collect the impacted absorbents. All impacted absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in the same 55-gallon drum. HCE labeled and staged the pail onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report X-2023080493
item.description:
Report X-2023080493

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived in unload with wet, broken cardboard on opposite sides of the box. Package was isolated in QA in a lined tote. Spill appears to have been largely contained by the box, no other packages were harmed by the spill. DescribePack: One bottle of Luster Detergent had a loose, freely spinning cap. This bottle leaked a noticeable amount of liquid into the package, destroying the label and 2 sides of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated in a lined tote in QA.

item.title: Report E-2023080026
item.description:
Report E-2023080026

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-22T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, two (2) 5-liter metal cans of UN1263 were crushed during transit and released approximately one quarter (.25) gallon of product to the pallet in the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel downstacked the pallet to find two (2) leaking cans of product. Crews wiped down the impacted freight with universal absorbent pads, and then they staged the remediated freight for further shipment and processing. The leaking cans and miscellaneous cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room. Crews took the impacted pallet back to their shop for reuse.
